intro: Gagea taschkentica, commonly known as the Tashkent lily, is a bulbous perennial plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive in its native habitat. Gagea taschkentica is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
